snippet: Like the shopping events it held for “The Help” and “Eat Pray Love,” the HSN network will mount another for the coming “Snow White and the Huntsman.”
abstract: Elizabeth Olson Advertising column observes HSN, formerly known as the Home Shopping Network, is mounting a shopping event on May 30 for the coming movie Snow White and the Huntsman to drum up viewer interest.

headline.main: HSN Plans Event to Sell ‘Snow White,’ the Merchandise
headline.print_headline: HSN Plans Event To Sell ‘Snow White,’ The Merchandise

snippet: The moment of truth has come for Microsoft and Nokia. They have set an April 8 release date and $100 price tag for the Lumia 900, which runs Microsoft's new mobile operating system, and will test Americans' loyalty to Apple's iPhone and phones run...
abstract: The moment of truth has come for Microsoft and Nokia. They have set an April 8 release date and $100 price tag for the Lumia 900, which runs Microsoft's new mobile operating system, and will test Americans' loyalty to Apple's iPhone and phones running Google's Android operating system.

headline.main: Nokia's Lumia 900 Gets a Price and Release Date

snippet: Mike Daisey, the writer and performer of the disputed one-man show "The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs," wrote on his blog that, "When I said onstage that I had personally experienced things I in fact did not, I failed to honor the contract I...
abstract: Mike Daisey, the writer and performer of the disputed one-man show "The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs," wrote on his blog that, "When I said onstage that I had personally experienced things I in fact did not, I failed to honor the contract I'd established with my audiences over many years and many shows."

headline.main: Mike Daisey Apologizes for Falsehoods in Monologue About Apple
headline.print_headline: Daisey Says He ‘Failed’ Audiences With Falsehoods

snippet: Plus: a new industrial revolution, a guide to Pinterest, why everyone lies about pricing and our boss of the week.
abstract: Plus: a new industrial revolution, a guide to Pinterest, why everyone lies about pricing and our boss of the week.

headline.main: This Week In Small Business: Captain America Returns

snippet: Joe Ratterman, BATS Global's chief executive, recounted in an interview how much his company had prepared for its initial public offering -- only to see months of work undone by an unforeseen technical mistake.
abstract: Joe Ratterman, BATS Global's chief executive, recounted in an interview how much his company had prepared for its initial public offering -- only to see months of work undone by an unforeseen technical mistake.

headline.main: BATS Chief on Friday's Troubles: 'My Stomach Sank'

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

snippet: The computer software giant won a court order to enter two Web hosting facilities last week in a war against so-called botnets that scour the Internet for personal data to steal and exploit.
abstract: Microsoft wins a court order to enter two Web hosting facilities in a war against so-called botnets that scour the Internet for bank account passwords and other personal data to steal and exploit; sweep is part of firm's aggressive campaign to take the lead in combating such crimes, rather than waiting for law enforcement to act.

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and NICOLE PERLROTH

snippet: We need to redefine “parking lot” to include something that offers a variety of public uses, mitigates its impact on the environment and looks good, too.
abstract: Op-Ed article by urban planning Prof Eran Ben-Joseph suggests ways in which the idea of a parking lot could be improved.

headline.main: When a Parking Lot Is So Much More
headline.print_headline: When a Parking Lot Is So Much More

snippet: Omgpop’s popular game Draw Something attracted the attention of the game maker Zynga, which bought the company for $180 million.
abstract: Omgpop’s popular smartphone game Draw Something attracts the attention of the game maker Zynga, which buys company for $180 million; deal shows how companies are moving quickly to stay on top of online trends, generating quick reversals of fortune.

headline.main: A Game Explodes and Changes Life Overnight at a Struggling Start-Up
headline.print_headline: A Game Explodes and Changes Life Overnight at a Struggling Start-Up

byline.original: By BRIAN X. CHEN and JENNA WORTHAM

snippet: The singer unveiled some new songs from her forthcoming fourth album at a sold-out concert at the Music Hall of Williamsburg in Brooklyn.
abstract: Jon Caramanica reviews performance by singer and songwriter Fiona Apple at the Music Hall of Williamsburg.

headline.main: Fiona Apple Returns to the Faithful
headline.print_headline: Fiona Apple Returns to the Faithful
